message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper introduces a novel method for converting text-based data into abstract image representations, which is then used to train an image classification neural network for name disambiguation. This method could potentially be applied to other NLP comparison problems, such as disambiguation of academic publications or data linkage problems. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper involves image processing techniques, which suggests the sub-categories cs.CV (Computer Vision) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) are also likely. Finally, the paper uses a neural network for classification, indicating the sub-category cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a possibility.
